scientific realism大概係講「一個正確既scientific theory入面講既野係truth/approximate truth 」（希望無理解錯）
例如粒子咁樣，因為佢解釋到好多野所以realist會認為粒子應該真實存在
但anti-realist就會認為粒子只係我地detect到某d野而我地覺得係由粒子引起，但其實根本就無直接見過粒子呢樣野。例如cloud chamber到見到既軌跡咁樣，只係因為我地見到佢係一條線，所以覺得係由粒子造成，但實際個原因可能同我地諗既好唔同

anti-realism都有分好多派，例如instrumentalism認為science只係一個工具，咩係”truth”並唔係science既範圍

而我同你對wave particle duality既理解就係偏向anti-realism

replies.msg: Momentum 係 mass 乘 velocity, velocity 係 vector 梗係有方向

Wave-particle duality is purely empirical observation.
The uncertainty principle can be seen is this way: sometimes actual wavefunctions need to use linear combinations of eigenfunction to yield the actual, "desired" wavefunction, and each eigenfunction yields different eigenvalues and each eigenvalue corresponds to different value of momentum (value of momentum is found when the eigenfunction is acted on by the momentum operator).
Actual wavefunctions with a very defined location need a linear combination of a very large amount of eigenfunctions with different eigenvalues/momentum when we use the momentum operator to it, which means there is an extremely large amount value of momentum.
The vice versa is also true: a wavefunction with a precisely defined momentum would also have even probability appearing at different places due to the definition of probability of finding a particle in quantum mechanics.
